basic_intent.semantic_description: Add HTTP_REFERER and HTTP_RESPONSE_REDIRECT_LOCATION tags to existing HTTP request spans in the CLM web application.

sub_tasks.name: Locate OpenTelemetry Configuration & HTTP Pipeline
sub_tasks.description: Search the CLM-web solution for OpenTelemetry setup and existing HTTP enrichment logic.
tasks: grep / ripgrep / VS ‘Find in Files’ for keywords: "AddOpenTelemetry", "ActivitySource", "SetTag", "AddTag", ".UseOpenTelemetry"
Identify the project that owns the public web entry point (likely Clm.Web, Clm.WebHost or similar)
Open Startup.cs / Program.cs and any *TelemetryExtensions.cs to understand how instrumentation is added
Confirm whether manual ActivitySource instrumentation or ASP.NET Core auto-instrumentation is being used
sub_tasks.validation_criteria: All configuration files and any custom middleware that already calls Activity.SetTag have been documented

sub_tasks.name: Design Enrichment Hook
sub_tasks.description: Decide the best location to enrich spans once headers are final.
tasks: If custom OTEL middleware already exists, plan to extend it
Otherwise design a new ASP.NET Core middleware placed AFTER routing but BEFORE exception/response compression middleware so that both request headers and final response headers are available
sub_tasks.validation_criteria: Middleware insertion point documented and agreed on with team

sub_tasks.name: Implement Middleware / Enrichment Logic
sub_tasks.validation_criteria: Build succeeds and new tags compile without warnings

sub_tasks.name: Unit Tests & Static Analysis
sub_tasks.description: Create or update unit tests validating tag presence.
tasks: Add integration test using TestServer to simulate a 200 with referer and a 302 with Location
Run static-analysis search (CI step) to verify exactly two new tag names appear
sub_tasks.validation_criteria: Tests pass locally and on CI

sub_tasks.name: Local Manual Verification with OTLP Collector
sub_tasks.description: Run CLM-web locally with OTLP exporter pointing to a Docker collector + Jaeger to inspect spans.
tasks: Verify new attributes show up in Jaeger UI or console exporter

sub_tasks.name: Performance & Security Review
sub_tasks.description: Ensure no PII or sensitive querystring leaks; run BenchmarkDotNet or kestrel perf tests.

sub_tasks.name: Pull Request & Code Review
sub_tasks.description: Open PR, tag Observability and CLM owners; link to ticket; attach test screenshots.

sub_tasks.name: Deploy to Dev / Demo Environment
sub_tasks.description: Use existing release pipeline with feature flag ‘otel_redirect_enrichment’ set to ON for Demo only.

sub_tasks.name: Post-Deployment Validation in Demo
sub_tasks.description: Run the provided Kusto query in Demo cluster.
tasks: Confirm HTTP_REFERER and HTTP_RESPONSE_REDIRECT_LOCATION columns populated
Sample at least 100 spans; expect ≥95 % have referer when header present
sub_tasks.validation_criteria: Query returns expected data; screenshot stored in ticket

sub_tasks.name: Rollout to All Environments
sub_tasks.description: Gradual exposure: 10 % → 50 % → 100 % over 2 days with telemetry checks at each step.
sub_tasks.validation_criteria: No error-rate or latency regression; attributes visible in Prod

sub_tasks.name: Documentation & Knowledge Share
sub_tasks.description: Update internal observability run-book, add new attributes to CLM telemetry field dictionary.
sub_tasks.validation_criteria: Confluence page updated, link in ticket

sub_tasks.name: Close Ticket
sub_tasks.description: Mark ticket Done once acceptance criteria satisfied and validated.

contextual_hints: Hooking into the response after the status code and Location header are finalized so the redirect tag is always populated
Guaranteeing the new enrichment runs for every request path (including static files, error pipeline, etc.) without imposing noticeable latency
